infoSections.text: Arduino communication systems allow interaction between microcontrollers and external devices using serial communication, I2C, SPI, or other protocols. Python, using Spyder or another IDE, provides a platform for processing, analyzing, and visualizing data collected from Arduino-connected sensors.

In neurotech, this hardware-software interfacing is essential for applications like brain-computer interfaces (BCIs), biofeedback systems, and neural signal processing. Arduino can collect biosignals (e.g., EEG, EMG), transmit data to Python, and use machine learning or signal processing techniques for real-time feedback or control.
